item.title: Christmas Is Celebrated As A Second Valentine's Day In Japan. Here's Why - News18
item.description:
Christmas Is Celebrated As A Second Valentine's Day In Japan. Here's Why

Date: December 25, 2024
Source: News18

Christmas in Japan is not just a religious holiday but is celebrated as a second Valentine's Day with great enthusiasm, emphasizing romantic relationships. This phenomenon arose after World War II and has evolved into a uniquely Japanese tradition.

  • Japanese Christmas focuses on couples celebrating together, often through fine dining and hotel stays.
  • History shows that Christianity faced suppression in Japan for over 250 years, only gaining popularity after American cultural influence post-World War II.
  • Despite having a small Christian population, the holiday has become a significant cultural event filled with lights, decorations, and a festive atmosphere.
  • Japan's low marriage and birth rates make Christmas an important cultural boost for promoting couple togetherness.
“Christmas provides an opportunity for couples to spend quality time together.”

This unique approach to Christmas reflects Japan’s adaptation of Western influences, creating a celebration that enhances social bonds in a society facing declining marriage rates.

item.title: Wall Street Holiday: Nasdaq, NYSE to remain closed for trading on December 25 on account of Christmas celebrations | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Wall Street Holiday: Nasdaq, NYSE to remain closed for trading on December 25 on account of Christmas celebrations

Date: December 25, 2024 Source: Live Mint

The US stock markets, including Nasdaq and NYSE, will be closed on December 25 in observance of Christmas. Early closures occurred on Christmas Eve as well.

  • The Nasdaq and NYSE will not conduct trading on Christmas Day.
  • The US stock exchanges closed early on December 24 at 1 p.m. EST.
  • The next closure will be on January 1, 2025, for New Year celebrations.
  • Japan's Nikkei share average dropped slightly due to Wall Street's closure.
  • Last five trading days of the year historically show positive gains.
  • US market is still on pace for strong returns in 2024 despite concerns over political policies.
“The benchmark S&P 500 is up 26.6 per cent this year and remains within roughly one per cent of the all-time high it set earlier this month.”

This closure reflects the observance of Christmas, a significant holiday for many, impacting trading activities on some of the world's largest stock exchanges.

item.title: India now has over 73,000 startups with a woman director: Government - The Times of India
item.description:
India Surpasses 73,000 Startups Led by Women Directors

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

The Indian government reports that the country now boasts over 73,000 startups with women directors, showcasing the growing role of women in entrepreneurship.

  • This marks a significant milestone for women in the Indian startup ecosystem.
  • The government continues to promote initiatives aimed at enhancing female participation in business.
  • This increase is indicative of the changing dynamics in the workspace, encouraging women to take on leadership roles.
"Women are increasingly embracing entrepreneurship as a viable career path in India," stated a government spokesperson.

This trend not only signifies the empowerment of women in business but also contributes to the overall economic growth of the country.

item.title: Personal loans: How fintech has reformed instant lending ecosystem — 8 key changes | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Personal loans: How fintech has reformed instant lending ecosystem — 8 key changes

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Live Mint

Fintech is revolutionizing the instant loan sector, making the process faster, more efficient, and more accessible for borrowers.

  • Smoother application processes through online platforms and mobile apps.
  • Improved accessibility for individuals and small businesses in semi-urban areas.
  • Bespoke loan offerings with competitive interest rates.
  • Credit assessment using non-traditional data sources.
  • Improved regulatory compliance and data security measures.
  • Collaboration between fintech firms and traditional banks for offering instant loans.
  • Lower operational costs leading to competitive interest rates.
  • Encouragement of financial inclusion for gig workers and first-time borrowers.
“Fintech companies are playing a vital role in spreading the net of financial inclusion.”

This comprehensive transformation in the lending landscape is empowering a broader audience to access personal loans with greater ease and efficiency.

item.title: Nandini springs a surprise, launches ready-to-cook idli, dosa batter blended with whey protein - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Nandini Launches Whey Protein-Infused Idli and Dosa Batter

Date: 25 December 2024
Source: Deccan Herald

Bengaluru's Nandini brand has launched a ready-to-cook idli and dosa batter blended with whey protein, targeting a more nutritious traditional South Indian breakfast option.

  • The product was launched at Vidhana Soudha by Chief Minister Siddaramaiah.
  • The batter is available in 450g and 900g packs priced at Rs 40 and Rs 80, respectively.
  • The Karnataka Milk Federation aims to sell 3-4 tonnes of batter daily.
  • This batter is the first of its kind, aiming to add protein to traditionally carbohydrate-heavy meals.
  • The product will initially be tested in Bengaluru before expanding to other markets.
"Traditional South Indian breakfasts like idli, dosa and upma only have carbohydrates and lack protein, which is an important nutrient." - KMF Official

The introduction of whey protein to idli and dosa batter represents a significant innovation in the realm of traditional South Indian cuisine, emphasizing nutritional value for busy consumers.

item.title: N Srinivasan resigns as CEO, MD of India Cements after CCI approves ₹7,000-crore UltraTech deal | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
N Srinivasan Resigns as CEO and MD of India Cements Following UltraTech Deal

Publication Date: December 25, 2024

Source: Live Mint

N Srinivasan, the CEO and MD of India Cements, has resigned following the acquisition of a significant stake by UltraTech Cement.

  • N Srinivasan and board members resigned immediately after UltraTech's 32% acquisition.
  • UltraTech Cement acquired 10.13 crore equity shares, representing 32.72% of India Cements.
  • India Cements is now a subsidiary of UltraTech Cement.
  • N Srinivasan's family members also stepped down from the board.
“The resignation comes due to the consequent cessation of control by the existing promoters over the company.”

This acquisition marks a significant change in the management structure of India Cements and reflects the ongoing consolidation in the cement industry.

item.title: N Srinivasan resigns as CEO, MD of India Cements after CCI approves ₹7,000-crore UltraTech deal - Mint
item.description:
N Srinivasan resigns as CEO, MD of India Cements after CCI approves ₹7,000-crore UltraTech deal

Publication Date: December 25, 2024

Source: Live Mint

N Srinivasan has resigned from his position as CEO and MD of India Cements following UltraTech Cement's acquisition of a 32 percent stake in the company, resulting in its classification as a subsidiary.

  • N Srinivasan and several board members stepped down after the acquisition.
  • The Competition Commission of India approved UltraTech's ₹7,000-crore deal for significant ownership of India Cements.
  • UltraTech now holds approximately 55.49% of India Cements' equity share capital.
  • New directors have been appointed to the board post-resignation.
“UltraTech has acquired sole control of the company and has become the promoter.”

This acquisition marks a significant shift in the Indian cement industry, where consolidation and competition between major corporate groups are intensifying.

item.title: In a first, micro insurance premium in life segment tops Rs 10k cr in FY24 - Business Standard
item.description:
Micro Insurance Premium in Life Segment Exceeds Rs 10,000 Crore in FY24

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

In 2023-24, new business premium (NBP) in life insurance’s micro-insurance segment surpassed Rs 10,000 crore for the first time, driven primarily by private insurers.

  • Overall NBP rose to Rs 10,860.39 crore, a 23.5% increase from FY23.
  • Individual NBP decreased by 23.78% to Rs 152.57 crore.
  • Group NBP increased by 24.61% to Rs 10,707.82 crore.
  • Private insurers contributed over Rs 10,708.4 crore in this segment.
  • The total number of persons covered reached 178.39 million.
  • Micro-insurance agents numbered 102,000 at the end of FY24.
  • 4.49% of agents were from non-government organisations.
“Micro insurance offers affordable products to help low-income people cope with financial losses.”

The significant growth in the micro-insurance sector indicates rising awareness and accessibility for low-income groups in India.

item.title: Thrissur District Commission Holds State Bank Of India Liable For Delay In Delivery Of Debit Card - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Thrissur District Commission Holds SBI Liable for Debit Card Delivery Delay

Date: 18.12.2024 Source: Live Law

The District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission in Thrissur ruled that the State Bank of India branch was liable for delays in issuing a debit card to a customer, leading to a compensation order.

  • The complainant applied for a new debit card on July 4, 2022, due to the expiration of the previous card.
  • Despite repeated requests, the card was not delivered in a timely manner.
  • The customer sent a compensation request of Rs 10,000 per month for the delay.
  • The card was eventually received on November 16, 2022, but compensation was not provided.
  • The Commission found the bank at fault for the deficiency of service.
  • The Commission awarded Rs 10,000 as compensation and Rs 5,000 for litigation costs, with 9% interest.
“In the era of digital banking... the respondent bank has failed to provide timely services.”

In conclusion, the ruling emphasizes the bank's responsibility in ensuring timely service and the importance of customer rights in financial transactions.

item.title: 5 Upcoming Mahindra EVs In 2025-26 You Should Know About - GaadiWaadi.com
item.description:
5 Upcoming Mahindra EVs In 2025-26 You Should Know About

Publication Date: November 2024 Source: Gaadi Waadi

Mahindra & Mahindra is gearing up for a significant expansion of its SUV lineup, introducing new electric models under the XEV and BE series over the next 24 months. The brand plans to electrify several of its existing ICE-powered SUVs to provide eco-friendly alternatives while solidifying its market position.

  • Mahindra XUV 3X0 EV expected to debut in early 2025, with a real-world range of around 400 km.
  • Mahindra BE 6E priced at Rs. 18.90 lakh; XEV 9E priced at Rs. 21.90 lakh, both slated for showroom debut next month.
  • Plans for a seven-seater variant of the XEV 9E and a potential three-row version of the BE 6E are in development.
  • The XUV 700 based zero-emission SUV will be the production version of the XUV.e8 concept.
“Mahindra aims to combine conventional ICE offerings with new-age electric vehicles.”

The upcoming EV range from Mahindra demonstrates its commitment to transitioning towards sustainability while offering exciting new models for consumers.

item.title: The bank behind the fintech revolution stumbles after customer funds go missing | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Crisis at Evolve Bank After Customer Funds Go Missing

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Company Business News

Scot Lenoir has led Evolve Bank from a regional institution to a prominent player in Silicon Valley, but it now faces a crisis as customers can't access their funds, prompting withdrawals after a business partner failure.

  • Evolve Bank managed around $10 billion for fintech firms like Stripe and Affirm.
  • It provides banks to fintechs that need a partner to handle customer funds.
  • A significant number of customers are affected by the recent issues with accessing their money.
“Evolve Bank turned a sleepy farming bank into one of Silicon Valley’s top financial partners.”

This incident highlights the vulnerabilities in the fintech banking model as user trust is undermined.

item.title: Medical Negligence: NCDRC Holds Doctors Of Fortis Hospital Liable - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
NCDRC Holds Fortis Hospital Doctors Liable for Medical Negligence

Date & Source: Published on [Publication Date], Live Law

An appeal by Fortis Hospital was dismissed by the National Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission (NCDRC), which held that the hospital and two of its doctors were liable for medical negligence leading to the death of a patient. The commission observed that the hospital failed to meet the required standard of care and established negligence under the principles laid down in Jacob Mathew.

  • The patient, suffering from a spinal condition, was admitted to Fortis Hospital for surgery.
  • Post-surgery complications arose, including a collapsed lung and quadriplegia, and the patient died.
  • The complainant argued that the hospital was negligent in its treatment, and the NCDRC agreed, upholding the state commission's order.
  • However, the specific liability of two doctors was not sufficiently proven, and their appeal was allowed.

The commission observed that the hospital performed surgeries without adequate pre-operative tests or proper informed consent, leading to the patient's condition worsening post-surgery.

The NCDRC upheld the state commission's order, finding Fortis Hospital and two of its doctors liable for compensation. The case highlights the importance of standard medical practice and the burden of proof in medical negligence cases.

item.title: Ola Expands To 4,000 Outlets Across India, Rs. 25,000 Worth Offers On S1 - GaadiWaadi.com
item.description:
Ola Expands To 4,000 Outlets Across India, Rs. 25,000 Worth Offers On S1

Publication Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: Gaadi Waadi

Ola Electric has announced a significant expansion of its retail presence across India, now totaling 4,000 outlets. Along with this expansion, exclusive offers of up to Rs. 25,000 are available on the S1 portfolio today only.

  • Opened over 3,200 new retail outlets, leading to a total of 4,000 across India.
  • Exclusive benefits of up to Rs. 25,000 on the S1 portfolio on December 25, 2024.
  • Discounts and perks available, including Rs. 7,000 off on S1 X series and Rs. 5,000 on select credit card EMIs.
  • Introduced MoveOS 5 with new features such as Group Navigation, Live Location Sharing, and Smart Charging.
  • Launched limited-edition S1 Pro Sona with gold-plated elements.
  • Reservations for new scooters start at Rs. 499, with deliveries scheduled for April and May 2025.
"This is the largest EV retail expansion in India, enhancing access to electric vehicles across various regions."

The expansion and offers signify a major step forward for Ola in the EV market, aiming to increase accessibility and customer engagement.

item.title: Bigger And Powerful Fortuner Rival Now Rs 6 Lakh Cheaper! - MotorOctane
item.description:
MG Gloster Offers Huge Discounts Ahead of Facelift

Publication Date: Not specified Source: MotorOctane

The MG Gloster is currently available at significant discounts ahead of its anticipated facelift launch, making it a competitive option against the popular Toyota Fortuner.

  • MG is offering discounts and benefits up to Rs 5.5 lakhs on the Gloster.
  • The Gloster includes features like 6 airbags, ABS with EBD, and advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS) level 1.
  • The current price of the MG Gloster ranges from Rs 47 lakh to Rs 53.25 lakh (on-road, Mumbai).
  • The update of the MG Gloster is expected to debut at the 2025 Bharat Mobility Show.
“Currently, MG is working on the updated version of the Gloster, with expected enhancements in interior design and technology.”

In conclusion, the MG Gloster is positioning itself as a more attractive choice for buyers looking for premium features at a lower cost as the facelift approaches.

item.title: Outlook 2025: Tata Steel, JSW, JSPL, SAIL others; Improvement in domestic steel prices hold key | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Outlook 2025: Tata Steel, JSW, JSPL, SAIL others; Improvement in domestic steel prices hold key

Date: December 23, 2024

Source: Live Mint

As steel prices remain largely stable, the performance of major steel stocks has varied throughout 2024. While Jindal Steel & Power has shown substantial returns, other players like Tata Steel and SAIL face challenges.

  • Jindal Steel & Power Ltd recorded a 27% return this year.
  • Tata Steel and JSW Steel have seen gains up to 5%; SAIL's shares have declined by 4-5%.
  • Factors impacting steel prices include flat domestic prices and increased imports due to weak global demand, particularly from China.
  • Concerns about rising input costs, particularly iron ore, due to proposed mining taxes in Karnataka.
  • Domestic steel demand is expected to remain resilient, but the capacity utilization of the steel industry may drop below 80%.
"Finished steel imports into India are poised to grow by 30%, touching 10 million tonne in CY2024." - Ritabrata Ghosh, ICRA Limited

The outlook for domestic steel prices in 2025 hinges on multiple factors, including international market conditions and government trade policies affecting steel imports.

item.title: China Sets Another “World Record” With 58,000-Tonne Cargo Ship Akin To Fujian Aircraft Carrier: Chinese Media - EurAsian Times
item.description:
China Sets Another 'World Record' With 58,000-Tonne Cargo Ship Akin To Fujian Aircraft Carrier: Chinese Media

Date: December 22, 2024   Source: Chinese Media

China has achieved a new milestone in shipbuilding with the successful trials of the Fan Zhou 8, a 58,000-tonne cargo ship that is now officially seaworthy after completing five days of testing.

  • The Fan Zhou 8 measures 256 meters long and 51 meters wide, with a range of 16,000 nautical miles.
  • It can reach speeds over 15 knots and is classified as polar-ready.
  • The ship’s design allows it to carry a diverse range of cargo, making it a versatile asset in commercial shipping.
  • China’s shipbuilding industry holds 59 percent of global orders, solidifying its leading position.
“Creating such a vessel further strengthens China’s position as a global leader in shipbuilding.”

This record-breaking ship represents China's advancing maritime capabilities and its strategic focus on enhancing its industrial output.

item.title: Stock picks for 2025: Rudra Murthy recommends these top 10 stocks to buy; 3 sectors he is bullish on | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Stock picks for 2025: Rudra Murthy recommends these top 10 stocks to buy; 3 sectors he is bullish on

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Live Mint

CA Rudra Murthy B.V. advises investors to focus on value rather than momentum in 2025, emphasizing large-cap stocks amidst a challenging market for Indian stocks.

  • The benchmark indices Nifty 50 and Sensex are down nearly 9-10% from their all-time highs.
  • Murthy suggests that investors should be cautious and seek out undervalued stocks.
  • He expresses confidence in specific sectors for growth opportunities.
“Investors will be better off chasing value rather than momentum in 2025.”

Overall, Murthy's insights provide a roadmap for navigating the upcoming market uncertainties by seeking value-driven investment opportunities.
